definition: indecisive/wavering
surname Yao
to shake/to rock/to row/to crank
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
(negative prefix)/not/no
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: He vacillates from agile, amiable, and arch to repetitive and awkward.
sentences.chinese: 他摇摆不定的敏捷，和蔼可亲，并拱重复和尴尬。

sentences.english: Doubts about this eternal truth come because of the wavering Mind.
sentences.chinese: 对此永恒真理会产生怀疑是因为心念摇摆不定。

sentences.english: The staggering totals indicate why McGrady needed to get to the hoop.
sentences.chinese: 摇摆不定的数据表明了为什么麦迪需要更靠近篮圈。

sentences.english: Mr Samaras, as opposition leader, has taken an equivocal position.
sentences.chinese: 作为反对派领袖，萨马拉斯的立场摇摆不定。

sentences.english: My emotions continued to seesaw between pleasure and embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 我的心情也依然在高兴与不自在之间摇摆不定。

sentences.english: He constantly wavers in his feelings toward her.
sentences.chinese: 他不断地摇摆不定，他对她的感情。

sentences.english: Between these two images she wavered, hesitating which to believe.
sentences.chinese: 她在这两个影象之间摇摆不定，不知道该相信哪个好。

sentences.english: These elements will turn Vietnam into a "two-faced" nation.
sentences.chinese: 这些元素会使越南转变成一个摇摆不定的国家。

sentences.english: "Tergiversate" is Word of The Year 2011 according to Dictionary. com.
sentences.chinese: “摇摆不定”当选为“字典网”的2011年度热词。

sentences.english: The president vowed to rally Americans and wavering lawmakers alike.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马誓言团结美国民众和摇摆不定的国会议员。

sentences.english: Police said his eyes were glassy, his speech thick and his walk unsure.
sentences.chinese: 警方说他的目光迷离，说话声音嘶哑，走路摇摆不定。

sentences.english: They stagger from liquor, They reel in their visions, They totter in their judgments.
sentences.chinese: 他们见异象时摇摇晃晃，行审判时摇摆不定。

sentences.english: China's energy-intensity data are as wobbly as other indicators.
sentences.chinese: 中国的能源消耗数据如同其他指数一样摇摆不定。

sentences.english: Korea's relations with American have long seesawed between peace and peril.
sentences.chinese: 南韩和美国的关系在和平与紧张中长期摇摆不定。
摇摆不定的美国对外政策。

definition: to hesitate over what move to make (idiom); to waver/to shilly-shally
to oscillate without pause (idiom)/to fluctuate/(of thoughts) to wander/to waver
hesitancy/indecision/to waver
to drift without a resting place (idiom)/roving/errant/vagrant/erratic
(idiom) to hesitate/to remain undecided
indecisive/irresolute
sb who goes whichever way the wind blows/sb with no mind of their own/easily swayed person/opportunist
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
to hesitate/indecisive
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
unstable/erratic/changeable/fickle
to hesitate
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
unrest (social or political)/turmoil/upheaval/commotion
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to worry about personal gains and losses
